text: Hi <@UFEMNG3RA> We currently don't have any Rails tutorials to help with setting up an Oauth connection. The good news is that this is something we are working on improving. We have recently set up a Sample Apps page: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/sample-apps> which we will be expanding and improving on in 2020 and hopefully we can get some sample Rail apps in there :gem: for you!

Looking at some discussions in our developer community I did find this thread: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/How-to-implement-HubSpot-API-using-Ruby-on-rails/td-p/240266> where one user suggests using this HubSpot REST API wrapper for ruby. Let  me know if this helps or if you need any more help?

Many thanks <@UFBDBKQ1H> ,I call the HubSpot API with no issues, but just the Oauth 2
I use Devise gem with omniauthable function but I have an issue (my token is not stored).
I try to test another solutions...:+1:

Thanks <@UKVEALXC2>, <@UDU6KEBFB> sorry for my lack of response during the holiday week here in the US, let me know if you have any issues with implementation here, connor’s solution is the correct one here
That all seems to check out, <@UDU6KEBFB>!

thanks! and If I'd like to edit the creation date of a queued deal if there's change made to its associated deal custom date property, I could do so by creating a webhook subscribtion for this date property and then postpone the deal creation. Right?
